en: Bugs Bunny, an animated rabbit/hare, is one of the most popular and recognizable cartoon characters in the world
Bugs Bunny is the corporate mascot for Warner Brothers, especially its animated productions
Bugs Bunny was "born" in 1938 in Brooklyn, New York City
Mel Blanc is Bugs Bunny’s original voice actor
Bugs Bunny's accent is an equal blend of the Bronx and Brooklyn dialects
In 2002, Bugs Bunny was named by TV Guide as the “greatest cartoon character of all time”
Wile E. Coyote is also known simply as "The Coyote
Letter “E” (in Wile E. Coyote) never refers to a name within the context of the cartoon, but a 1975 comic has it standing for 'Ethelbert'
Jones based the Coyote on Mark Twain's Roughing It, in which Twain describes the coyote as "a long, slim, sick and sorry-looking skeleton
Jones said he created the Coyote-Road Runner cartoons as a parody of traditional "cat and mouse" cartoons like Tom and Jerry
Mickey Mouse is a comic animal cartoon character that has become an icon for The Walt Disney Company
Mickey Mouse was created in 1928 by Walt Disney and Ub Iwerks and voiced by Walt Disney
The Walt Disney Company celebrates his birth as November 18, 1928 upon the release of Steamboat Willie
Minnie Mouse full name is Minerva Mouse
Minnie Mouse’s father is Marcus Mouse
Minerva Mouse has twin Nieces named Millie and Melody
In many appearances, Minnie is presented as a close friend of Daisy Duck, Donald Duck’s girlfriend
Tweety Bird is also known as Tweety Pie or simply Tweety
The name "Tweety" is a play on words, as it originally meant "Sweetie", along with "tweet" being a typical English onomatopoeia for the sounds of birds
Despite the widespread speculation that he was female, Tweety is and has always been a male character
The name of Tweety Bird’s owner is Granny
Tweety was created in 1942 by Bob Clampett through the short “A Tale of Two Kitties”
The names of the two hungry cats are Babbit and Catstello (based on the famous comedians Abbott and Costello)
On the original model sheet, Tweety was named Orson
Donald Duck is a white anthropomorphic duck with a yellow-orange bill, legs, and feet
Donald Duck usually wears a sailor shirt, cap, and a red or black bowtie, but no pants
Donald Duck wears pants when he goes swimming
Donald's most famous trait is his easily provoked and occasionally explosive temper
Donald's full name is Donald Fauntleroy Duck
Donald is the uncle of the triplets Huey, Dewey and Louie
Donald's birthday is officially recognized as June 9, 1934, the day his debut film, The Wise Little Hen, was released
The voice of Donald was performed by Clarence “Ducky” Nash, a voice actor, up to 1983
Since 1985, Donald has been voiced by Tony Anselmo, who was trained by Nash for the role
Daisy Duck was created as a female counterpart and girlfriend to Donald Duck
Daisy Duck first appeared in the cartoon “Mr. Duck Steps Out” in 1940
Daisy Duck usually wears either no pants herself or a dress. She is mostly shown as showing a strong affinity towards Donald
Daisy Duck and Minnie Mouse are close friends
Daisy Duck's voice was provided by Clarence Nash and was a slightly higher version of that of Donald
Hello Kitty is the best-known cartoon characters created by Sanrio of Japan
The Hello Kitty trademark has spread globally; Sanrio earned over $1 billion annually in sales outside of Japan, as of 2003
Hello Kitty is a very simply drawn character who was created in 1974 by the Sanrio Company in Tokyo
Hello Kitty's boyfriend “Dear Daniel” was created in 1999
Hello Kitty is also friends to Bobby Jack Monkey, another Sanrio creation
The name of Hello Kitty's pet cat is Charmmy Kitty
Hello Kitty's pet hamster is called Sugar
The earliest Hello Kitty animated series known, was the American-animated (co-produced with Japan) Furry Tale Theatre which aired throughout 1987
Popeye the Sailor is a fictional hero famous for appearing in comic strips and animated films as well as numerous TV shows
Popeye was created by Elzie Crisler Segar and first appeared in the daily King Features comic strip Thimble Theatre on January 17, 1929
Popeye has appeared in comic books, television cartoons, a 1980 live-action film, arcade and video games, and hundreds of advertisements and peripheral products
Casper the Friendly Ghost’s family name is McFadden
Casper was created in the late 1930s by Seymour Reit of New York City and Joe Oriolo
Oriole provided the illustration of Casper while Reit provided the idea
Winnie-the-Pooh, commonly shortened to Pooh Bear is once referred to as Edward Bear
This fictional bear (Winnie-the-Pooh) was created by A.A. Milne
The character first appeared in book form in Winnie-the-Pooh (1926) and The House at Pooh Corner (1928)
Winnie-the-Pooh became one of Walt Disney Company's most successful franchises worldwide
The Pooh stories have been translated into many languages
Garfield is a daily comic strip created by Jim Davies
Garfield's owner is Jon Arbuckle
The comic strip Garfield holds the Guinness World Records for being the world’s most widely syndicated comic strip
Garfield debuted on June 19, 1978. This date is regarded as Garfield’s birthday. He is now 39 years of age
Scooby-Doo is a talking dog, and is a long-running American animated TV series
The original series, Scooby-Doo, Where Are You, was created for Hanna –Barbera Productions by writers Joe Ruby and Ken Spears
Scooby-Doo’s cousin is Scooby-Dum and his nephew is Scrappy-Doo
Other characters of Scooby-Doo include the four teenagers Fred “Freddie” Jones, Daphne Blake, Velma Dinkley and Norville “Shaggy” Rogers
Snoopy is a fictional character in the long-running comic strip Peanuts, by Charles M. Schulz
Snoopy is a pet beagle of Charlie Brown
Snoopy is one of the most recognizable comic characters in the world
The original drawings of Snoopy were based on Schulz's childhood dogs, Snooky and Spike
Snoopy was born on October 2, 1950
Animation producer Bill Melendez voiced Snoopy and in numerous television specials from 1965 to 2006
The Tasmanian Devil, often referred to as "Taz", is one of the most recognizable members of the Looney Tunes roster
Taz was created by Robert McKimson and based the character on the real-life Tasmanian Devil
Taz is constantly hungry and devours everything, animate or inanimate
Taz’s speech, peppered with growls screeches, is provided by Mel Blanc
Tom and Jerry was created by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera for MGM
Tom and Jerry is a successful and long-running series for over six decades of theatrical short subjects
The cartoons "Tom & Jerry" centered on a never-ending rivalry between a housecat and a brown mouse, whose chases and battles often involved comic violence
Hanna and Barbera have written 114 Tom and Jerry cartoons between 1940 and 1957
Tom & Jerry is one of the most-awarded theatrical animated series
The creators of ‘Rugrats’ are Arlene Klasky and Gábor Csupó
The characters Stu and Didi are based on the creators
All of the babies are voiced by women
«Rugrats» is the second longest running Nickelodeon series of all time with 172 episodes, coming second only to «SpongeBob SquarePants»
Rugrats" is the only Nickelodeon show to have its very own star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, earning the honor in 2001
The Pickles family live at 1258 North Highland Avenue in Los Angeles which is the original home of the Klasky Csupo production office
In 1998 "The Rugrats Movie"came out and included celebrity voices such as David Spade, Whoopi Goldberg, Margaret Cho, and Busta Rhymes
One of the creators of the show "Rugrats", Arlene Klasky, reportedly hated Angelica for quite a while. She didn't like that Angelica was such a bully
The character design of Angelica from "Rugrats" is based on one of the writers' niece, Emica
The show "Rugrats" has earned over 20 awards, including 4 Daytime Emmys, 7 Kid Choice Awards, and 5 Emmys
The Rugrats Movie" was the first non-Disney animated movie to gross over $100 million at the box office
In the cartoon "Rugrats" Angelica is the oldest of the Rugrats at three years old
Angelica Pickles (from Rugrats) was put at number seven in TV Guide's 50 Greatest Cartoon Characters, beating classics like Bart and Lisa Simpson and Mickey Mouse
A running gag in the show "Rugrats" is that the babies say "Bob" instead of "God". For example "A baby is a gift from a Bob
Tommy (from Rugrats) was walking at 5-6 months, which is quite early for a baby. The average age for a baby to start walking is around 10 months
Steven Spielberg has cited "Rugrats" as one of the greatest animated series of our time
In "Rugrats" Favorite cartoon-hero of children was the dinosaur Raptor, it was inspired by Japanese pop culture
The creator of "The Ren & Stimpy Show", John Kricfalusi, was kicked off the show because the network thought the episode "Man's Best Friend" was too violent
Billy West, the voice of Stimpy, is also the voice of Fry on Futurama
Flea, the Red Hot Chili Peppers' bassist, was the voice of Donnie in The Wild Thornberrys
Tracy Grandstaff, the voice of Daria, is currently the vice president of Comedy Central
Onward and Upward," an episode that depicted Ren and Stimpy as bisexual, was banned from Nickelodeon
The Lion King is the highest-grossing hand-drawn animated feature of all time with a total box office of over $987 million
The film’s first director, George Scribner, wanted the movie to be a sort of animated National Geographic
Lion King is the last Disney movie to be supervised by Jeffrey Katzenberg before he left to form DreamWorks
An earthquake in 1994 forced the Disney Studios to close down temporarily and much of the film "Lion King" was finished in the artists’ homes
The first script of Lion King was named which was titled King of Beasts, then King of the Jungle
The Lion King was the first Disney animated film that was a completely original storyline without adaptation from fairy tales
Pumbaa is the first Disney character to ever fart
Rowan Atkinson actually had to learn and practice the lyrics for the scene when Zazu sings for Scar (in movie Lion King)
The song “Hakuna Matata” wasn't originally in the script Lion King, instead, there was a song called "He's Got it All Worked Out" which sang about eating bugs
Scene of a stampede with computer graphics in the cartoon The Lion King - was made about 3 years, and last only 2.5 minutes
The constellation Leo is in the night sky, not just the stars in the movie "The Lion King" when Mufasa is talking to Simba
Disney sent a team of animators to Hell’s Gate Nartional Park in Kenya in 1991 in order to perform research for the film The Lion King
More than one million drawings were created for the film The Lion King, including 1,197 hand-painted backgrounds
When Simba collapses on the cliff, it appears that the pollen that flies off the cliff forms the word “SFX,” the abbreviation for the special-effects team that worked on the film
Scar’s army of hyenas assemble in linear formation and begin marching. It’s inspired by an image of Adolf Hitler watching a Nazi procession
Scar is the only lion in the movie "The Lion King" that has claws
The man who voiced for Optimus Prime also gave voice to Eeyore and Nintendo’s Mario
Hulk was Originally Grey and not Green
Jim Davis’ Garfield is printed in 7 different languages
Donald Duck comics were banned from Finland because he doesn’t wear trousers
Superman, Spider-Man and Batman are the three most popular American superheroes known and beloved worldwide
Mel Blanc (the voice of Bugs Bunny) was allergic to carrots
Pinocchio is Italian for “pine eye”
Crusader Rabbit was the first animated series, airing from 1949-1951
The most expensive animated film was The Prince of Egypt (1998, the US), which cost 60 million dollars to make
The Pokemon Hitmonchan are based on Jakie Chan
In Japan, more paper is used to print comic books than to make toilet paper
If you want to buy the first Super Man comic, it will cost you at least $150,000
Pauvre Pierrot this is 15-minute animation, made from 500 hand-painted images in 1892
The very first animated film was probably the now-lost El Apóstol, made in Argentina in 1917
In the late 17th century the word ‘cartoon’ was applied to any drawing on stout paper or card
The best animated feature oscar (longer than 40 minutes) was first awarded at the 74th academy awards in 2001 and was won by Shrek
Paul Winchell, who was the voice of Tigger in the Disney films, was the first person to design and patent an artificial heart
The earliest cartoon strip, named "The Yellow Kid", was shown in the New York Journal in 1896
The longest running primetime animated series is the Simpsons, which began in 1987
The theme tune to the PBS cartoon 'Arthur' was recorded by Bob Marley's son, Ziggy
Walt Disney disliked the Goofy cartoons and only continued the series to make-work for his animators
1990 McDonalds produced an anti-drug cartoon featuring all popular cartoon characters at the time
Walt Disney slowed down a cartoon to 12 cycles and the viewers became sick for days
Shaggy's (from Scooby Doo) real name is Norville Rogers
Beanie and Cecil run less than a month and aired only five episodes
In Mexico Donkey Kong appeared as a dark orange blobby looking creature with a green Mohawk and a horn in the middle of his forehead
Fat Albert and The Cosby Kids was chosen the 82nd best animated series
G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero. The characters are named after real people
Heathcliff was originally a comic strip. Heathcliff's friends appeared in the Catillac Cats
Legend of Zelda.This animated series is based on the video game from nintendo
Pac-Man's merchandising was huge, having produced over 400 products. This animated series led to the creation of the Ms. Pac-Man video game
